page.title: 14INDUSTRY
page.content: Many factories have closed at the Estate.The workforce has been cut by 75% in 14 years.In 1971, 4923 people earned their living there.Now there are just 1,247 with a further 360 rendundancies announced at STC.STC buildings make up almost 1/3 of the site.After October 1985 all that will remain of what was Brighton's biggest factory will be the 130 design engineers working at a smaller site in Crowhurst Road. Chubb Cash Registers have been cutting back since 1978 and pulled out in 1982,transferring some workers to Hove and Lancing.Leytools transferred their offices to London in 1984 Some bright spots remain -Wade Engineering moved to Chubb's building. Wyncote Developments are using Leytools' site and is building 25 units.Others are still operating.
